sentence.Network_en: Loyalty and support became the bywords of the day.

sentence.Network_en: There were too many other demands on his loyalty now.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在还有太多其他的事情也要求他忠心。

sentence.Network_en: In his diary of 1944 he proclaims unswerving loyalty to the monarchy.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在1944年的日记里声称对君主忠贞不贰。

entry.def: Loyalty is the quality of staying firm in your friendship or support for someone or something.

example.ex: I have sworn an oath of loyalty to the monarchy...
This is seen as a reward for the army's loyalty during a barracks revolt earlier this month.
example.tran: 此举被视为是对在本月初一场军营叛变中表现忠心不贰的军队的奖赏。

entry.def: Loyalties are feelings of friendship, support, or duty towards someone or something.

example.ex: She had developed strong loyalties to the Manet family.
example.tran: 她对马内家族忠心耿耿。

means.word_mean: 3. the act of binding yourself (intellectually or emotionally) to a course of action;

sentences.sentence: "they felt no loyalty to a losing team"

auth_sentence.content: Loyalty is hard to buy but easy to squander.

Sentence.sentence: But what was perhaps most astonishing about Mr Jobs was the absolute loyalty he managed to inspire in customers.
He commanded absolute loyalty from Apple users

sentences.en: No one could ever doubt her loyalty.
sentences.cn: 谁也不会怀疑她的忠诚。

sentences.en: We all have a loyalty to the company.
sentences.cn: 我们都对公司忠心耿耿。

sentences.en: If the interviewer asked about your family or school speak with loyalty and affection.
sentences.cn: 当面试官提到你的家庭和学校时，你说话时要显得忠诚和热爱。

jushi.english: No one could ever doubt her loyalty.
jushi.chinese: 谁也不会怀疑她的忠诚。

jushi.english: We all have a loyalty to the company.
jushi.chinese: 我们对公司都有效忠的义务。

jushi.english: He had divided loyalties, he wanted to be loyal to the company, but he also wanted to do what was best for his family.
jushi.chinese: 他有相互抵触的忠诚,既想对公司尽心,但又想为家庭尽责。
